chapter.title: Introduction
chapter.para: This chapter explains installation, and gives an overview of the features and interface of the &orocos; &motcontrol; module.

sect1.title: Installation
sect1.para: Install the Orocos Geometry and Kinematics package first, we use it for all the kinematic calculations. A package is provided on the Orocos web page.

&orocos; uses the eCos tools for configuration and building. Therefore the configuration and building process is pretty well standardised. We refer to the Orocos Base installation instructions for the advised configuration and installation procedure.

sect1.title: Prerequisites
sect1.tip: We highly advise you to read first the Orocos CoreLib and Control Kernel documentation before going on.

This document only covers some generic use cases. If you want detailed information about a class or function, read the Doxygen generated reference of this package. You will find a lot of complementary information in there not presented here.

sect1.title: Control Components
sect1.para: This section gives an overview of the services used for control
We refer to the source code documentation or the doxygen generated files for the most recent documentation about which functions exist and do what.

sect2.title: The Control Kernel
sect2.para: Components must be loaded into a control kernel to be useful. The Control Kernel is fully explained in the orocos-control-kernel.html document.
